Interface to NREL database¶

One of the projects at NREL that uses the STREAMM toolkit is the Organic Photovoltaics (OPV) modeling effort. High-throughput density functional theory (DFT) calculations are used to screen candidate molecules so as to let synthetic chemists focus on only the most promising materials for energy applications. The simulation results from ~10,000’s of calculations are stored in the NREL OPV database The STREAMM toolkit is used not only to generate the simulation files needed to perform the DFT calculations, but also to access and effectively mine the massive amounts of data generated on the Peregrine compute cluster. The python modules and scripts that enable efficient access to the OPV database is described below.

Description of OPV data¶

Column Type
project_id integer
project_name character varying(150)
oligomer_id integer
tag character varying(150)
oligomer_number integer
backbone_type_name character varying
molecule_type character varying(150)
bblock_list character varying[]
isomer_type character varying(10)
conformer_type character varying(10)
oligomer_created_on timestamp without time zone
oligomer_result_id integer
basis character varying(150)
oligomer_result_date_added timestamp without time zone
oligomer_result_created_on timestamp without time zone
date_calculation_finished timestamp without time zone
oligomer_result_last_updated timestamp without time zone
homo numeric(45,20)
lumo numeric(45,20)
optical_lumo numeric(45,20)
homo_contour numeric(45,20)
lumo_contour numeric(45,20)

total_energy numeric(45,20)
mu2_x numeric
mu2_y numeric
mu2_z numeric
mu2_tot numeric
dipole_difference numeric

cation_reorganization_energy numeric(45,20)

Desciption of opvSQL python module¶

class opvSQL.OPVSqlBase(user, pswd)[source]¶

Class for managing data and opv SQL database attributes

createSimObjsFromTag(tagStr)[source]¶

For a tag string, returns coords from the database in a simulation object

Args:
tagStr (str) tag string of oligomer entry (eg D1_R3R3_A48__)
Returns:
list of simulation objects (SimulationGaussian1)
generateParallelCoordCSV(searchTags, fileName='foo.csv')[source]¶

Run SQL command and dump to CSV format. Creating a parallel coordinate file suitable for reading in hdvis3 application

Args:
searchTags (list) List of strings to insert as parallel coords fileName (str) Name of .csv file
getBasisScatter()[source]¶

Gets structure results from db along with basis string and colors

Args: Return: List of x,y,z, colors values suitable for scatter plot

getClusteringData(eps, cullVal=None)[source]¶

Searches structure db for all fields with the corresponding tags and makes a 3d scatter plot

Args:
eps (float): distance param for clustering
getMetaData(tagStr)[source]¶

Runs select get_json_meta(tagStr,1) e.g. select get_json_meta(D1_R1R100_A1_R3R30000_,1) Takes metadata string and formats into a dictionary with blank values for nstates, basis, accuracy. Updates the timestamp in the metadata dictionary

Args:
tagStr (str): tag string in db eg D1_R1R100_A1_R3R30000_
Returns:
dictionary of metadata
getTotalResults()[source]¶
Find total number of various kinds of entries
  1. Total number in ‘oligomer’
  2. Total number in ‘structure’
  3. ...
molToSimObj(molEntry)[source]¶

For a mol string in STREAMM database, parse information/parameters and return a StructureContainer with atom positions

Args:
molEntry (str): mol string
Returns:
3-tuple: (runName, basis, StructureContainer)
newResultsCount(numDays)[source]¶

Get a count of the oligomers loaded within the last week, and store the count to a variable

Args:
numDays (int) Number of days to search for new results

Take 3D scatter coords and coloring list

data (tuple): 4 tuples of 3D coords and colors strings nameStr (str): File name string cullPts (int): Number of points to plot (for speed)

Analyze 1D-histogram

dat (): result of histogram object idstr (str): middle string tag for output file xlab (str): x-axis label ylab (str): y-axis label

runBasisStats()[source]¶

Get info about basis-s used for Gaussian calculations in database

runSQLCmd(sqlCmd, verbose=False)[source]¶

Submit SQL string to database and return results Print stats

Args:
sqlCmd (str) : SQL command string verbose (bool): Flag for printing results to screen
Returns:
Converts results in cursor object to a list of lists. The outer list corresponds to lines of results as if command submitted directly to ‘kestrel’ sql database. Number of elements in inner list depends on string command
selectBasisData(tagSearch, basisName='6-31g(d)')[source]¶

Gets structure results from db along with basis string and colors

Args:
tagSearch (str): Power search string basisName (str): name of basis for calculation (default to standard b3lyp)

Return: List of x,y,z, colors values suitable for scatter plot

setSelectStr(s)[source]¶

Set/reset select string. This is a comma separated string that follows the ‘select’ keyword for SQL queries (eg “homo_extrapolated,gap_extrapolated,lumo_extrapolated”)

Args:
s (str): comma separated ‘select’ string
splitFixedLine(line, cols)[source]¶

Split a string with fixed format given by ‘cols’ into a list of strings

Args:
line (str): input fixed format string cols (list): list of integers for position of end of each column
Return:
split list of columns strings
tagCheckSQLDataLine(searchTags, datLine)[source]¶

Analyze tag in data line and insert ‘flags’ into line and convert to a comma separated string

Args:
searchTags (list) List of search strings tags eg [“A1”, “A2”, ...] datLine (list) Input data [“D1_R1R800_A48__”,-5.454,1.663,-3.5519]
Returns:
Comma separated string (suitable for output to csv file)
testCSV(fileName='foo.csv')[source]¶

Run SQL command and dump to CSV
